title: Questions you might be holding
intro: Short, honest answers. They do not replace a live conversation, but they help you sense whether our coaching is right for now.

items.q: What is coaching, and how is it different from therapy or consulting?
items.a: Coaching is a collaborative, future-leaning conversation where you stay in charge of choices. We follow ICF ethics, ask reflective questions and co-design experiments. We do not diagnose, treat, or give directive advice like therapists, consultants or lawyers.

items.q: What if I might need therapy instead?
items.a: We notice this with you and can pause coaching to signpost qualified clinical or crisis services. Coaching is not a substitute for therapy, medical care, or emergency support.

items.q: How do I choose a package?
items.a: Match your situation to the three focuses: Transition, Confidence, or Experiments. Each page explains who it serves, what we cover and what is out of scope. If it is unclear, book the intro call and we will decide together.

items.q: What training and background do you bring?
items.a: We are ICF-trained coaches with experience in social innovation, migration support and organisational change. Lived experience of moving countries, rebuilding careers and holding care roles shapes how we coach.
Start with the 20-minute intro call. We explore your context, clarify boundaries, discuss fees transparently and you decide whether to continue. There is no pressure to commit on the call.

items.q: How should I use your articles?
items.a: Treat them as prompts for reflection or conversation. They are not instructions, guarantees or a replacement for professional advice. Credit us if you share publicly.

items.q: How should I use your resources?
items.a: Use them as tools you can adapt for self-reflection or team conversations. They do not replace therapy, legal, financial or immigration advice, and outcomes remain your responsibility.
